title: file full path discloser.

profile.name: Paragon Initiative Enterprises
profile.about: Cryptography and Application Security Consultants - We Produce Various Open Source Libraries

vulnerability_information:
Hi,
Paragonie security team i found one directory browsing vulnerability in php-encryption-master where the user input will not been filtered from any security layer.
let me show you.
there is a autoload.php page in the php-encryption-master. where the input src will b used to browse the directory so this input will not been tested and fetch the file from directory and return to user.
this attack will highly affect your product and may invite for other attack to.

so i hope you will protch it as soon as possible.

thank you,
security researcher,
lucky sen
vulnerability_information_html:

Paragonie security team i found one directory browsing vulnerability in php-encryption-master where the user input will not been filtered from any security layer.
let me show you.
there is a autoload.php page in the php-encryption-master. where the input src will b used to browse the directory so this input will not been tested and fetch the file from directory and return to user.

activities.message:
Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to inform us of your findings.

> Paragonie security team i found one directory browsing vulnerability in php-encryption-master where the user input will not been filtered from any security layer.

If you look carefully, this is a *forked* repository which we only possess as a consequence of contributing to the upstream repository. If you would like, I can open a ticket in the upstream repository. (If you would like to, however, please feel free.)

Once [defuse/php-encryption](https://github.com/defuse/php-encryption) version 2 has been released, I anticipate we will no longer have need for our forked repositories and can therefore delete them.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to inform us of your findings.

Paragonie security team i found one directory browsing vulnerability in php-encryption-master where the user input will not been filtered from any security layer.

If you look carefully, this is a forked repository which we only possess as a consequence of contributing to the upstream repository. If you would like, I can open a ticket in the upstream repository. (If you would like to, however, please feel free.)

Once defuse/php-encryption version 2 has been released, I anticipate we will no longer have need for our forked repositories and can therefore delete them.
